title: How to Defeat an Oceanid in Genshin Impact

steps.title: Prepare for the battle.
steps.content: Prepare for the battle. The Oceanid is immune to all Hydro attacks, meaning you will need to have party members with elements that react with Hydro. Pyro, Cryo, Geo, and Electro all react with Hydro resulting in vaporize, frozen, crystallized, and electrocharged, while Anemo, and Dendro are all ineffective in fighting the Oceanid. You will also want a character that can regenerate your other characters' health, such as Noelle. If you do not have a character that can regenerate HP, then you will need a lot of food, and you will need to pay attention very closely. Select characters of the highest level to deal the maximum damage. This is because of the timed nature of the battle; if you are unable to defeat the hydro mimics within a certain period of time, a whirlpool will emerge underneath, draining your current character's health until it is down or until it explodes. This cannot be avoided.

steps.title: Teleport to the waypoint in the cave in Wuwang Hill.
steps.content: Teleport to the waypoint in the cave in Wuwang Hill. This is located east of the Hidden Palace of Zhou Formula domain and located underground. You will see a large platform in the middle of a large lake.

steps.title: Head north into the lake.
steps.content: Head north into the lake. Continue heading north until you reach the platform. It will start to rain and the sky will start to get foggy.

steps.title: Climb onto the platform.
steps.content: Climb onto the platform. Approach the blue circle on the ground to start the battle.

steps.title: Teleport to the waypoint north of Stone Gate.
steps.content: Teleport to the waypoint north of Stone Gate. It should be located on an elevated path.

steps.title: Head southwest on the path.
steps.content: Head southwest on the path. Keep on heading in this direction until you get off the ramp.

steps.title: Head west following the mountain.
steps.content: Head west following the mountain. Eventually, you will find a cave.

steps.title: Travel through the cave.
steps.content: Travel through the cave. You will find some minerals and a few enemies that you will need to defeat.

steps.title: Activate the waypoint at the end of the cave.
steps.content: Activate the waypoint at the end of the cave. Once you reach the end of the tunnel, you will see a large platform in the middle of a large lake.

steps.title: Head north into the lake.
steps.content: Head north into the lake. Continue heading north until you reach the platform. It will start to rain and the sky will start to get foggy.

steps.title: Climb onto the platform.
steps.content: Climb onto the platform. Approach the blue circle on the ground to start the battle.

steps.title: Know how the Oceanid launches attacks.
steps.content: Know how the Oceanid launches attacks. Instead of directly attacking you, it will launch different hydro mimics that attack you and that you must defeat to deal damage. These spawn in groups of one or two on a given platform.

steps.title: Avoid a Water Boar's charge.
steps.content: Avoid a Water Boar's charge. If a Water Boar spawns, then you will have to avoid its charges. To do so, dash out of the way as soon as one runs towards you.

steps.title: Keep back from a Water Squirrel's attack.
steps.content: Keep back from a Water Squirrel's attack. They will attempt to deal damage to you from close range. If you can stop the squirrel from pouncing on you, you should be okay.

steps.title: Avoid the Water Crane's waves.
steps.content: Avoid the Water Crane's waves. They can affect you even from afar. To do so, you can dash out of the way.

steps.title: Keep clear of the Water Hawk.
steps.content: Keep clear of the Water Hawk. These will swoop down to deal damage to your character. You can do so by dashing out of the way when one swoops down or by throwing down a taunt object (like Amber's Baron Bunny).

steps.title: Watch out for the Water Duck.
steps.content: Watch out for the Water Duck. These will follow you around with a water vortex underneath, dealing damage over time. To do so, stand clear of the circle that the Water Duck is sitting in.

steps.title: Stand clear of the Water Crab.
steps.content: Stand clear of the Water Crab. These will spray water bubbles at you, dealing damage over time. To do so, move from the path of the bubbles.

steps.title: Move away from the Water Sparrow's attacks.
steps.content: Move away from the Water Sparrow's attacks. These pounce and leap, dealing massive damage. When it leaps, dash out of its circle.

steps.title: Dodge the Water Frog's attacks.
steps.content: Dodge the Water Frog's attacks. These will splash you and tackle you in close range. In addition, it will leap to deal damage. When it leaps, dash out of its circle, and when it sprays, move away from the stream.

steps.title: Watch out for the explosions.
steps.content: Watch out for the explosions. After defeating the Water Sparrow and Water Frog, a bubble will form where they were defeated. This bubble may follow you and explode upon touching it. The range of this explosion is very long, so be aware of this while fighting the Oceanid. They will also explode after a preset time period.

steps.title: Keep clear when the platform sinks.
steps.content: Keep clear when the platform sinks. Every two waves, the Oceanid will sink two platforms. If you are unfortunate enough to be standing on a sinking platform, you will both end up in the water and you will take some damage.

steps.title: Be quick when defeating the enemies.
steps.content: Be quick when defeating the enemies. If you are too slow, a whirlpool will emerge from under you. When the Oceanid calls out "Submerge", the whirlpool will quickly obliterate your current character.

steps.title: Use Cryo to freeze the land mimics.
steps.content: Use Cryo to freeze the land mimics. This will result in frozen. After, deal a charged attack to shatter the ice and deal even more damage.

steps.title: Use Pyro to vaporize the land mimics.
steps.content: Use Pyro to vaporize the land mimics. This will deal more damage to the land mimics, as with all the other elemental reactions. Vaporize is also a very powerful elemental reaction, so it’s crucial to use a Pyro character such as Amber, Xiangling, or Thoma, just in case.

steps.title: Use Electro to shock the land mimics.
steps.content: Use Electro to shock the land mimics. This will result in Electro-Charged, which can deal lots of damage. This will also electrocute nearby land mimics and deal more damage over time.

steps.title: Use ranged characters to tackle the Water Hawks.
steps.content: Use ranged characters to tackle the Water Hawks. This includes Amber, Fischl, Diona, and Lisa. These characters are some of the only ones able to attack the Water Hawks.

steps.title: Use the time between waves to heal.
steps.content: Use the time between waves to heal. You can eat food or use a healing character like Diona or Noelle to regenerate your character's HP, so you won’t have to worry about dying.

steps.title: Repeat to the end.
steps.content: Repeat to the end. After tackling each wave, the Oceanid will disappear underwater and a Ley Line Blossom will spawn in the arena. The first two waves will contain one land mimic type, the next two waves will contain two land mimic types, and the final wave will also contain two land mimic types.

steps.title: Locate the Ley Line Blossom.
steps.content: Locate the Ley Line Blossom. This looks a bit like a wilted flower and is probably in the center of the arena.

steps.title: Use the Resin to revitalize the blossom.
steps.content: Use the Resin to revitalize the blossom. If you do not have enough Original Resin, you can use Fragile Resin instead.

steps.title: Collect rewards.
steps.content: Collect rewards. Depending on your level, you may get different rewards, but you will always get Cleansing Heart and 100 EXP, which is a critical Character Ascension Material for Hydro characters.
